Here's my take from the call
- Some of us (I think most but Marius and perhaps Lukasz) think that we have a solution for validity
- Some also think that we have a solution for availability if we deal with either RPC requests for head split views or commit summaries to the block.

author: potuz
content:
There are three invariants that I can see
- Current one: a transaction can only be invalidated by sending from the same address
- Current 3074: a transaction can only be invalidated by changing the state of the account that sent it (for example spending balances)
-  More abstract version: a transaction can be invalidated by any change in the execution state pertaining any storage slot of any contract.

Seems like the third one destroys completely any hopes for our designs.

author: potuz
content: We could in principle require that AA designers include enough annotations in their transactions as to make them compatible with ILs, but this quickly seems to devolve. Given Ansgar's comments before I tend to think that we should aim to solve up to the current 3074 status and no more
